DOC.brief_summary: 200 patients with insufficient great saphenous veins will be randomized to either radiofrequency ablation or high ligation/stripping (open surgery). They will be examined according to standardized examination protocol Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS), with duplex ultrasound and plethysmography pre- and postoperatively (1-month, 1-, 3 and 5 years). They are to fill questionnaires EuroQol 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) and disease specific Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire (AVVQ).
DOC.brief_title: Lower Limb Venous Insufficiency and the Effect of Radiofrequency Treatment Versus Open Surgery
DOC.criteria: Insufficient great saphenous vein Possible to treat with both radiofrequency ablation and high ligation/stripping Clinical Etiological Anatomical Pathophysiological score (CEAP) C2C6 Previous intervention in the affected leg Insufficient accessory branch origin close to the great saphenous vein estuary in the femoral vein. Small saphenous vein insufficiency with diameter >6 mm and/or flow >100ml/min Patient that is not able to perform plethysmography
